3.「……今 人と話す気分じゃないんだ。| 悪いけど ひとりにしてくれるかな。: I don't feel like talking to anyone right now.|I'm sorry, but could you leave me alone?

4.「……おや。リゼロッタから| 僕の頼みを 聞いてくれって 言われたのかい？: Oh. Lieselotte asked you to do me a favor?

5.「じつは トゥーラを ずっと練習していたら| 弦が 切れてしまってさ。| 弾くこ: I was practicing Tula for a long time, and I|broke a string. I couldn't play it, and I was|in trouble.

6.「いつもなら 予備の弦を持っているんだけど| 僕のかばんの中に しまったまま|: I usually have a spare string with me, but I|left it in my bag with my dad.

7.「キミが 父さんの持ってる かばんを| ここに届けてくれるなら 修理もできるけど: If you could get my dad's bag here, I could|fix it, but I don't think that's possible,|so...

8.「……それにしても 父さんと母さんは| いったい どこに行ったんだろう？| 一緒: But where the hell did Mom and Dad go? They|were supposed to come to Town of Celed|together.

9.「……トゥーラの弦が 切れてしまって| 弾くことが できないんだ。: I can't play my Tula because the strings are|broken.

10.「父さんが持っている 予備の弦が入ったかばんを| キミが ここに届けてくれるなら: My dad has a bag with spare strings in it that|you could deliver to me so I could fix it, but|I don't think that's possible.

11.「……それにしても 父さんと母さんは| いったい どこに行ったんだろう？| 一緒: But where the hell did Mom and Dad go? They|were supposed to come to Town of Celed|together.

12.「……おや？| もしかして セリクのファンの方ですか？: ...Oh? Are you a Fan Fan of Selik by any|chance?

15.「はるばる 入院先まで お見舞いに来てくださる| あなたのような 熱心なファンが: I didn't realize that there were still devoted|Fan Fans like you who came all the way to the|hospital to visit me...

16.「ほら セリク。| あなたに お客さんよ……。: Here, Selik. You have a visitor...

17.「この子は 身体の端から 少しずつ| 石化してしまう難病を わずらっていて| も:
She has an incurable disease that causes her|body to petrify little by little from the|edges, and she's been like this for a long|
|time.

18.「いつか グランゼドーラの音楽祭で| 優勝するのが夢だと言って がんばっていたの: He was working hard, dreaming of one day|winning the music festival in Gran Zedora, so|why, of all people, would our Selik...

19.「この おぞましい病気が治療できたとしても| 息子の指が 動くようになる保証はあ:
Even if this horrific disease can be cured,|there is no guarantee that my son's fingers|will ever work again. He will have to undergo|
|long and arduous training.

20.「その道中 ついに リャナ荒涼地帯の山道で| 意識を失ってしまい| それ以来 目: Along the way, he finally lost consciousness|on a mountain road in the Lyana Desolate Area|and hasn't woken up since.

21.「しかも この子が大事にしていた かばんも| 魔物に奪われてしまうし| まったく: And the bag that the little girl had treasured|so much was stolen by a monster... It's just a|series of mishaps...

22.「え…… そのかばんが どうなったかですって？| リャナ荒涼地帯の <%sEV_: What happened to the bag? It was snatched by|<%sEV_QUE_NAME0> in Lyana Desolate Area.

23.「そろそろ 検査のお時間です。| どうぞ お引き取りください。: It is time for your inspection. Please take|your seats.

24.「……おっと 時間のようですね。| この子も お客さんが来ると うれしいだろうし: Oh, it looks like it's time to go. I'm sure|she'll be happy to have a visitor, so please|come visit her again.

26.「ああっ それは 僕のかばんじゃないか！| 僕の両親は いったい どこにいたんだ: Oh, that's my bag! Where the hell were my|parents?

27.「……まあ トゥーラさえ直せれば| そんなこと どうだっていいか。| さあ かば: Well, as long as I can fix Tula, I don't|really care about that. Now, can you hand me|the briefcase?<yesno><close>

28.「……トゥーラが 弾けないと| 僕は 生きていけないよ。| お願いだから かばん: I can't live without Tula. Please, give me the|bag.<yesno><close>

30.「ありがとう。これで やっと| トゥーラの修理に とりかかれるよ。| さて……。: Thank you. Now I can finally get to work on|Tula. Now...

31.「ふふっ。すっかり 元通りさ。| それじゃ さっそく……。: Hmmm. I'm back to normal. Well then, let's get|started...

32.「どうやら セリクのトゥーラは| 無事に 直ったみたいですわね。| <pc>さん: It appears that Selik's Tula has been|successfully fixed. <pc> Thank you.

33.「ねえ セリク。| ちょっと お話があるから| 高台の教会の２階まで 来てくださ: Hey, Selik. Can you come upstairs to High|Church for a minute?

35.「トゥーラの練習が したかったのに……。| 大事な話って なんだろう？: I wanted to practice Tula, but what was so|important that I had to talk about it?

37.「へへっ あとは 主役だけだな！: Heh heh, now all we need is a leading man!

38.「おや なんだか にぎやかだね……？: Well, it's kind of lively, isn't it...?

39.「いったい どうしたんだい……？: What the hell is going on...?

41.「へへっ。びっくりしただろ？| ずっと ナイショにしてたんだぜ！: Heh heh. Surprised, right? I've been keeping|this a secret for a long time!

42.「女王様が あなたのために| パーティーをしようって 言ってね。| みんなで こ: JoOusama said she was throwing a party for|you. We've been secretly preparing for it.

44.「自分でお菓子を作るなんて はじめてだったから| おいしくできたか 自信ないけれ: It was the first time for me to make sweets by|myself, so I'm not sure if I was able to make|them taste good... but everyone helped me.

45.「それから あなたに| プレゼントも ありますのよ。: And I have a present for you.

46.「このロザリオは セレドの町の……。| 子供の国の一員としての 絆の証ですわ。: This rosary is a testament to our bond as|members of the Town of Celed... of the|Children's Kingdom.

47.「……これも キミたちの 手作りなのかい？: Did you guys make all this?

48.「ご両親がいなくて つらい時もあると思うけれど| そんな時は このロザリオを見て:
I know that you are going through a difficult|time without your parents, but when you feel|that way, look at this rosary and remember|
|that you have a companion in us.

49.「この絆がある限り あなたは| いつだって 私たちの大切な仲間よ。: As long as we have this bond, you'll always be|our precious companion.

50.「ありがとう……。こんなに 心のこもった| もてなしを受けたのは 生まれて はじ: Thank you... I've never received such|heartfelt hospitality in my life.

51.「みんなへの 感謝のしるしに| 一曲 プレゼントさせてもらうよ。: As a token of my appreciation to all of you, I|would like to present a song.

52.「ありがとう みんな。| こんな 晴れ晴れとした気持ちで| トゥーラを弾くのは: Thank you, everyone. It's been a long time|since I've played Tula with such a clear mind.

53.「僕は つい最近まで 手足の先から| だんだん石化してしまうという| おぞましい: Until recently, I was suffering from a|horrifying disease that gradually petrifies me|from the tips of my hands and feet.

54.「トゥーラを弾くどころか 立つこともできなくて| 僕に こんな運命を与えた神様を: I couldn't even stand up, let alone play the|Tula, and I spent my days cursing God for|giving me this fate.

55.「……でも こっちの世界に来たら| そんな病気は 跡形もなく 消えさっててね。|: But when I came to this world, that illness|disappeared without a trace. I can play the|Tula again.

57.「……やっぱり そうか。| グランゼドーラの音楽祭で 優勝する夢は| もう かな: ...I knew it. I guess my dream of winning the|Gran Zedora Music Festival won't come true|anymore.

59.「でも そんなこと どうでもいいよ。| 病気で苦しんで 指先も動かせない人生より:
But I don't care about that. I'd rather be|able to play as many songs as I want here than|suffer from illness and not be able to move my|
|fingers.

60.「僕の演奏で よろこんでくれる人もいるし| これ以上の幸せは ないよ。| みんな: There are people who are happy with my|performance, and I couldn't be happier. Thank|you all so much today!

61.「こちらこそ すばらしい演奏を ありがとう。| さあ おやつも たくさんあること: Thank you very much for your wonderful|performance. Now that we have plenty of|snacks, let's enjoy today to the fullest!

62.「おかげさまで セリクの歓迎パーティーは| 無事に 終わりましたわ。| さあ こ: Thanks to you, Selik's welcome party went off|without a hitch. Now, please accept this.

|was supposed to be incurable.

70.「僕の病気は いずれ死に至る 不治の病……。| あまり 長く生きられないことは|: I knew in advance that my disease, an|incurable disease that would eventually kill|me, would not last very long.

71.「まあ 死んだことなんて どうでもいいさ。| 立って歩くことも できなかった僕が: Well, I don't care that I'm dead. I can play|the Tula as long as I want, even though I|couldn't stand up and walk.

72.「……練習に打ち込みたいから| そろそろ ひとりにしてくれるかな？| 見られてい: ...I'd like to devote myself to practice, so|maybe it's time you left me alone. It's hard|to concentrate when you're watching me.

73.<pc>たちは セリクの歓迎パーティーで|楽しいひとときを 過ごした。: <pc> had a great time at Selik's|welcome party.

74.「今は 人と話す気分じゃないんだ。| 悪いけど ひとりにしてくれるかな。: I don't feel like talking to anyone right now.|I'm sorry, but could you leave me alone?
